rev.comment: /* CBS Lawsuit */ The contract is between Stern and Sirius not Stern and CBS or Sirius and CBS. Stern own his and CBS rights. He then contracts it to Sirius.

Started split. Need help fixing it up.

Again, even you admit, it is out of context. I will compromise and let the quotes stay, but I am going to add “jokingly” since that is what is was. A joke.
adding fact tags where citations are needed
/* The Move to Sirius Satellite Radio */ NPOV
/* The Move to Sirius Satellite Radio */ reorganizing

/* Claims of a Gag Order */ Small grammar. Please see talk page as to the POV problems I have with the "Howard Stern Imitators" quote.
/* Claims of a Gag Order */ I think the censorship quote is out of context (was said as a joke), let's split the diff though and use both.
/* Claims of a Gag Order */ Your quote is more POV. Howard claiming they are "imitators" is his point of view, and not necessarily the view held by others.
Article should not be at the bottom. The bottom contains a bunch of lists rather than paragraphs. Moved to a better place.
/* Notable Incidents */ He was joking when he said it. You are taking things out of context. The source article (FMQB) has always been a biased site against Stern. Replaced with an appropriate quote
/* Source Links and others */ removing innappropriate links
/* Fan Sites */ removing site that is just filled with ads.

/* Former Regulars */ Crackhead Bob just came on the show a week ago. Also, David Lee Roth was never a regular. Coming on the show means you are a guest not a regular.

23 hours out of the day on Howard 100 Stern's show is replayed.
